Reviews.Title: Great Phone ! Great Price !
Reviews.Author: Joshua Hare
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical buying this phone since I wasn't familiar with the manufacture but so far I am very pleased. The call quality is great. It doesn't feel cheap and it's of average weight. This is a perfect phone for the consumer who is looking to save money but who also wants a quality reliable device. If your looking for an Iphone or Galaxy SIII smart phone I think you might be disappointed but if you want a phone that is powerful enough for social media and you-tube and other internet related services I think you'll really enjoy this phone. The phone is incredibly responsive with a snapdragon processor and alot of RAM. The fact that it comes with Ice Cream Sandwich is also a bonus. Awesome phone, great value.

Reviews.Title: powerful phone
Reviews.Author: carlos
Reviews.Content: This phone is nice i like that it has a 4 inch screen.The phone is capable of playing  3d games good no lag graphics look better on lg motion but this one boots up way faster than lg or even galaxy.Gets warm not hot.Camera is nice it has a 1MP front camera i think if not VGA.Recommend it

Reviews.Title: Huawei Premia: Skeptical buyer review
Reviews.Author: S.H
Reviews.Content: I've never bought a phone from Huawei brand before, however, I wasn't disappointed. The phone is very fast with videos and web pages. It doesn't lag with games. At first, my battery life was draining very fast, but I began clearing my cache for apps after use and my phone's battery lasts most of the day (7+ hours) now even with occasional use of messaging, Facebook, YouTube, chatting, and web browsing. I love the small notification light on the right-hand side, alerting of FB notifications, voicemail, and messages. The user interface isn't bad either.I was looking for all these qualities inside a 4G phone from Metro PCS and decided against the LG Motion despite its popularity because of it's extremely small screen. I'm pleased to say that Huawei Premia has all of specs of an LG Motion, but with a considerably larger screen. If you are looking for a budget 4G phone with great qualities and a larger screen, I recommend the Huawei Premia.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade from the Motion; easily rooted
Reviews.Author: John Goggan
Reviews.Content: I have been using and was very happy with the LG Motion for over year.  Recently, my wife's old (non-Smartphone) phone died, so we decided to transfer my Motion to her and I bought this Huawei Premium to be my new phone.  Specs compared VERY closely to the LG Motion -- processor speed is very similar (the Motion is advertised as a dual-processing 1.2ghz phone, but actually runs at 1.5ghz out of the box for most people) -- except that this Premia has a larger screen (4" versus 3.5" in the Motion).  Benchmarks show the Premia generally beating out the Motion, but still being fairly close in performance.  Short version: the Premia is the better version of the Motion hardware.Also, just so people know, this Premia is currently EASILY rooted.  So, for those into doing their own thing, it is easy to root this phone and do what you like.  There is a nice Recovery bootloader that works fine -- so FULL "bare metal" backups and ROM replacements can be done without much worry.  There are some great ROM options out there -- if you'd really like to make the most of this phone.Hard to beat this phone in the sub-$100 range.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: O,Cuevas "Oz"
Reviews.Content: Great phone for the price I got it I wish I would have gotten two when I got this one. Anyway the phone works with ice cream sandwitch OS, the screen is better than the one on my lg spirit color wise and the battery last two days when all is adjusted for batt conservation. So no complaints very happy.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: José C.
Reviews.Content: Just what i wanted! Fast Phone, Cool to handle and awesome price! The Gorilla Glass is not as anti-Scratch as it says they are! But anyways is a nice phone!

Reviews.Title: It's Simple: You get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: DRICO
Reviews.Content: After doing extensive research on the LG Spirit phone and hearing how awesome it was, I decided to sign up with Metro, taking advantage of the no contract and pay half of what I was paying with Sprint. After visiting my local metro store, the salesman told me how great the Spirit was, but encouraged me to buy the Premia phone by Huawei. I was reluctant at first since I didn't do my research on this phone and I never even heard of the manufacturer. It was hard to say no since the authorized dealer was running a promotion, where I could get the phone, first months payment, and activation all for $100 and was told it was very much comparable to the Spirit but better since the Premia offers a 1.5 Dual Core versus the Spirit, which only has 1.2. Who could say no to that right? The Spirit didn't come with such offer. After 2 weeks of use, I'm so disappointed. I get dropped calls all the time, my alert icons don't show up sometimes on my activity bar to show if I had a missed call, or text, and it's just not practical or user friendly like other androids. I took it in for a factory reset, since they wouldn't give me a new phone on the first go-around but still experiencing the same issues. I'm going in tomorrow to exchange for the Spirit phone, which I should've bought in the first place. I have three words for you: DON'T BUY IT!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Every1BH
Reviews.Content: Pros: Really smooth, fast load time, fast boot, 3D games e.g: Dead Trigger, Modern combat 2,3,4, Nova.Cons: none yetIts my first HUAWEI brand phone, and im really impressed! Good Job!

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: A. Jewels
Reviews.Content: got this phone as a replacement after my husband lost his and we looked all over the stores with no luck.  perfect no frills phone that has all the capabilities of the major brands. about 50 dollars less than what it would have cost in a MPCS store.

Reviews.Title: nice phone
Reviews.Author: Giovanni Morales
Reviews.Content: for the price this phone has everything you can think of and more and great picture taking and easy to use

Reviews.Title: Fast processor and cheap ( but doesnt feel cheap)
Reviews.Author: Zenkenstein
Reviews.Content: At the time of this review this phone is one of the fastest for the price ($99.99). It blows the iphones out of the water all the way up to iphone 4s and in some areas it beats iphone 5. The upper iphones have more screen pixel density and more camera megapixels but this phone's processor is faster and has more RAM. The Premia's processor is faster than most phones that are three or more times the cost. I am buying another one for my wife.

Reviews.Title: Cheap!
Reviews.Author: wayne collins "Wayne Collins"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone from Metro Pcs a little over a week ago and thought I had scored a real winner. I didn't. DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE. While it has some good features it has the worst battery life of any cell phone I have ever bought. There is virtually zero support from the manufacturer and no manual. One must download a large PDF file which is vague at best. Also Metro PCS's support is non existent. Worst phone I ever bought but it only cost me $88 and I have no contract. Since its a prepay I have 3 weeks to find a better phone and write this one off to bad judgment and a lot of baloney from the Metro salesperson. The phone is a bomb at any price.

Reviews.Title: Dont bother, not worth the time or money!!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Long
Reviews.Content: At first I thought this was a very nice phone, a little heavy but not bad.  Then within a few months the problems began.  It started freezing up doing the simple tasks.  Then it started getting sluggish, had to turn off and on to make things work.  And now....the speakerphone function does not work at all.  Have tried multiple things to fix, no good.  Dont waste your time or money.  Cheap useless piece of crap!!!  Just limping along til after the holidays to get a samsung.

Reviews.Title: Buggy as f.....!!!
Reviews.Author: W. Sosa
Reviews.Content: This stupid phone restarts at least once a day, especially if under heavy load (CPU & RAM utilization). It is either running faster than advertised or has a memory dump problem. Other than that, yes it is fast and the screen is decent, not too scratch-resistant though( illumisheild!!). The camera is good quality and so is the audio(louder than my LG Connect!). If there is an over the air update to fix the system memory issues, maybe I will adjust my rating, till then...  YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR....

Reviews.Title: do not get it
Reviews.Author: Muse613
Reviews.Content: a) metro pcs phone service - blocks you from conference call phone numbers  so technically it is not unlimited phone service  (simple mobile, sprint and i think t mobile allow calls to 559 area code)b) it is a very heavy phone, brick like (with protective case if you buy)  for a small hand, you will get tired holding it... and then won't use it as muchc) metro pcs only gives you 7 days to return a phone as long as you spoke lessthan 60 minutes with iti've seen the ultra thin android phones, and they are easier to hold.avoid this phone and the carrier

Reviews.Title: not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: cupp3000
Reviews.Content: Great pictures, battery life is amazing for a smart phone.  Cant even but this phone from metro for less than a hundred

Reviews.Title: save your money
Reviews.Author: Justin Greer
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews from Engadget, PC Mag and the seeing the spec sheet i was led to believe that this would be a decent budget android phone with a fast connection, relatively speedy processor, and Wi Fi hotspot ....although it does succeed in some areas mainly the reasonable internet speed and casual YouTube viewing. This phone is a unstable, unresponsive, buggy piece of s***.... First off, It freezes an:d crashes while doing the most mundane tasks (facebook, Chrome, Instagram !!!!Txt-ing!!!) It pocket dials like crazy(how does a capacitive touch screen pocket text so easily is beyond me), it even reassigns contacts under other names. It it doesn't properly notify you of missed call and other app notifications (facebook, POF)it has some of the worst keyboards I've ever used including Swype....fyi the review was a pain in the ass to type with this phone....battery life Is not very good....its toggles airplane mode without your knowledge,although I have never dropped it, the "baboon" glass screen is very prone to scratches with mild abuse (bag travel, transit with keys) By comparison I have dropped my Photon 4G numerous of times your screen is still pristine.....in short the absolute worst Android phone I have ever had save your money and get the LG sprint or if you are in the available markets older nicer GSM/HSPA Android phones and get it  Unlocked to this phone is truly a piece of s***
